# Tutorial

# Import Code
```

```

# Installation
In Streamer.bot in select `Import` from the top left.
Copy the `Import Code` and paste it into the `Import String`. 

Once Installed you will need to make sure all the code compiles, if for any reason the codes do not compile then try adding.
```
System.dll
```
Once all execute codes compile then you have the base of Boss Battles installed and you can now edit it to your own needs.

# Configuration

So now that Boss Battles are Installed you will need to work out how you are firstly going to trigger the start of a battle. You can use Timed Actions, Channel Points or you can use the imported `!boss-start` command, just check you have it enabled and its not a duplicate of anything already pre-existing.

The Boss Battle Extension is designed so no matter how many people join, there is still a chance for both outcomes (Win or Lose). You have the power to make Each Boss Harder or Easier depending on the following settings.

|Setting/Argument|Description|
|---|---|
|`bossCPName`| This is just a name for the boss and has 0 impact on the difficulty of the boss|
|`bossCPMaxEntry`| This is how many viewers can join, The **more** that join the **easier** the battle is|
|`bossCPDefVal`|This is a defence value for the boss, the **lower** this is the **easier** the battle is|
|`bossCPAttVal`|This is the base attack value assigned to player, the **higher** this is the **easier** the battle is|
|`bossCPPrize`| This is just the payout if the users win and has 0 impact on the difficulty of the boss|

You can add Multiple bosses by just duplicating one of the folders already in there and changing the end number to the number of the boss.
![bossnewboss](/assets/points-system/images/bossnewboss.png)

As you can see from the image the arguments all end in `3` as this is the 3rd boss. 

In the `BossBattleJoin` Action you will see another folder with more settings with all these settings the **higher** they are the **easier** the boss will be. 

These settings will also have an impact on how much reward each person gets as the more points they put in, the more shares of the reward they will get. 

|Setting/Argument|Description|
|---|---|
|`bossCPVIP`|This is the number of extra points a VIP will put it.|
|`bossCPSUB`|This is the number of extra points a SUB will put it.|
|`bossCPMOD`|This is the number of extra points a MOD will put it.|

A User May be entitled to more than one point boost, if for example they are Mod and Sub. Broadcasters are classed as Mod and Subs and if you join you will be paid out as such if you join.

# Example Usage
```
Boss Reward is 10,000
5 users Join 
1 Mod, 1 Sub, 1 Vip&Sub, 2 Others (None VIP/MOD/SUB)
Mod adds 20 Points (10 base 10 mod)
Sub adds 25 Points (10 base 15 Sub)
VIP& Sub Adds 35 Points (10 base, 15 Sub, 10 VIP)
2 Others add 20 (10 base each)

Total Points = 100

Boss is Won/Defeated

Prize Per Point = 10,000 / 100 = 100
Mod Wins 20 * 100 = 2000
Sub Wins 25 * 100 = 2500
VIP & Sub 35 * 100 = 3500
2 Other win 10 * 100 = 1000 (each)
```

> The Points a person puts in directly impacts the amount they win, so if a battle is won the total won may not be the same as the starting prize amount, even if a single user enters an win you will find it may fall short of the prize pot {.is-info}
